June 11

Shadow Warrior 2 Announcement Trailer

YouTube™ Video: Shadow Warrior 2 - Announcement Trailer 
Views: 370,847
Coming to PC, Xbox One, and PlayStation 4 in 2016. http://www.shadowwarrior.com Shadow Warrior 2 is the stunning evolution of Flying Wild Hog’s offbeat first-person shooter following the further...



Shadow Warrior 2 is the stunning evolution of Flying Wild Hog’s offbeat first-person shooter following the further misadventures of former corporate shogun Lo Wang. Now surviving as a reclusive mercenary on the edge of a corrupted world, the formidable warrior must again wield a devastating combination of guns, blades, magic and wit to strike down the demonic legions overwhelming the world. Battle alongside allies online in four-player co-op or go it alone in spectacular procedurally-generated landscapes to complete daring missions and collect powerful new weapons, armor, and arcane relics of legend.

Read more over on the Shadow Warrior 2 Steam page and follow @ShadowWarrior on Twitter for the latest news.

Special Edition


The Shadow Warrior Special Edition includes Shadow Warrior, the Serious Sam 3 sledgehammer and Hotline Miami katana in-game weapons, the Shadow Warrior digital art book, and the official Shadow Warrior soundtrack.

Special Offer

READ MORE

About This Game

Shadow Warrior is a bold reimagining of the classic 3D Realms’ shooter from independent developer Flying Wild Hog (Hard Reset) starring the legendary and quick-witted warrior Lo Wang. Combine the brute force of overwhelming firepower with the elegant precision of a katana to annihilate the merciless armies of the shadow realm in an exhilarating and visually stunning transformation of the classic first-person shooter.

Story


Shadow Warrior tells the offbeat tale of Zilla Enterprise’s corporate shogun Lo Wang as he is ordered to acquire a legendary blade of limitless power by his deceitful employer. Betrayed and left for dead, Lo Wang learns of the blade’s connection to ancient gods from another realm preparing to push our world to the brink of destruction. Now the reluctant hero must become legend through a masterful combination of gun, blade, magic and wit to uncover the truth behind the demonic invasion and banish evil back into the darkness.

Features


Shadow Warrior Reborn – A bold new vision of Shadow Warrior elegantly blends classic first-person shooter gameplay with thrilling action, inventive combat, and a contemporary retelling of the hilarious legend of Lo Wang.

Elegant Swordplay – Unsheathe your legendary katana to slice enemies apart with precisely targeted swings or unleash fluid combos and special attacks to cut down hordes of enemies with one swift pass through the enraged hordes.

Upgradeable Arsenal – Utilize every gun in your formidable armory – from stylish revolvers and quad barrel shotguns to explosive-tipped crossbow bolts and laser-guided rocket launchers. Each weapon offers several unique upgrades to increase power, speed, and add devastating alternative firing options.

Mystical Powers – Call upon mystical powers to protect yourself and paralyze your enemies or use their own severed heads and still-beating hearts to bring them to their knees.
READ MORE

Windows
Mac OS X
SteamOS + Linux
    Minimum:
    • OS: Windows XP / Vista / 7 / 8
    • Processor: 2.4 GHz Dual Core Processor or higher
    • Memory: 2 GB RAM
    • Graphics: ATI Radeon HD 3870/NVIDIA 8800 GT or better
    • DirectX: Version 9.0c
    • Hard Drive: 15 GB available space
    • Additional Notes: An unabashed love of katanas is preferable.

Posted: June 16
What if I told you a shooter doesn't need to be realistic to be tactical?
What if I told you a game doesn't need 4k textures and a 50gb download to look good?
What if I told you dialogue doesn't have to be deep, intelligent or authentic to be entertaining?
What if I told you Shadow Warrior is one of the best shooters to come out on PC in the past 5 years?

Blood, guts, monsters, bosses, guns, a really fun 1st person sword fighting mechanic that works great with mouse or controller, and a whole lotta Wang. As a huge fan of old school corridor+arena shooters it really doesn't get much better than this.

Recommended
18.7 hrs on record
Posted: September 20
I paied for it less than 3 euros, I have played more than 18 hours so... It worth.

Beside that, lets see...

Do you like blood? There is a lot of blood, oceans of blood would be more correct.
Action? Yep, you won't rest.
Graphics? Japanese ambient, cherry trees, temples...
Are good the graphics? Yep.

Story? Well, there are 17 chapters. You will get lost for about 4 of them because you will only kill, dismember, burn etc but the story is good and you will get shocked at the end.

Controls? Easy, you will feel powerfull!!

So, If you want to enjoy killing a lot, a lot... a lot!!! of demons, play it. :D

Pinta
217 products in account
60 reviews
Recommended
40.7 hrs on record
Posted: June 21
„Over 5000 hitmen in the country and I still have to get a nerd. Where do you keep your porn?“
-Hoji

After finishing the game, I have to say it was great. I bought it because of it's concept - Japanese man killing demons using katana and other weapons. But I got a great story, which was unexpected. For it's price, it is more satisfiing than 60€ games.

Lo Wang, japanese hitman, is hired for a job. He has to get a sword at any cost. It's not a easy task and...let's say demons appear. He makes a deal with one of them and gets super inhuman powers. Lo Wang continues in his task and uncovers demon's story.

As you continue through game, you can upgrade weapons, powers and skills:
Weapons
- Each weapon has 3 upgrades, making the weapon more deadly (Akimbo, Laser targeting, Damage increase...)
Powers
- you collect "Ki crystals" that unlock you new moves and combos. I really like "Powers" system. When obtaining power, you will get a tatto. Each tatto symbolizes unique power(Dragon scales=defense and etc...). After obtaining all tatoos, you will have your chest and hands copletely tatooed. Looks nice.
Skills
- you obtain "Karma points", which can be exchanged for skill. Skill system is nice too. You have old japan artworks that you will make with each skill colorful. (Increases stamina, health, damage to enemies, luck, resistance...)

Pros+
+Great combat system
+Long, good story
+Weapon, Power and Skill system
+Challenging enemies
+Jokes (Titsubishi cars...)

Cons-
-Graphics
-Annoying suiciding enemies

8/10
Read More
